heading: nasdaq hits all-time high
subheading: investors are falling in love with tech stocks again, and their love is manifested in the nasdaq rising above 3,700 for the first time.
author: reuters
text: new york -- the surging nasdaq composite index rallied over the 3,700-point level for the first time ever thursday, hitting a high of 3,709.54 before throttling back by midday. the nasdaq was up 77.84 points, or 2.15 percent, at 3,699.79 after climbing to its all-time high. so far this year, the nasdaq up 68 percent."it looks like it's back to the same old story, with the techs just tearing off," said jim benning, director of trading at bt brokerage. "it's just a very narrow field of stocks pulling the indexes up."guy truicko, portfolio manager at unity management, said investors were rotating from other areas back into technology shares.there is not enough money (coming in) to keep all the sectors going in the same direction," he said. which was reflected in the numbers elsewhere.overall, stocks were mixed in late morning trading. the dow jones industrial average gave up early gains and was off 45 points, or 0.4 percent, at 11,180.declining issues beat advances 1,433 to 1,306 on the new york stock exchange. volume was a heavy 326 million shares.the standard & poor's 500-stock index was up 4.81 points, or 0.34 percent, at 1,418.14.microsoft was among the few gainers in the dow index. the stock was up 4-13/16 at 113-1/4 on optimism about the company's upcoming windows 2000 software.among other big technology shares, computer networking company cisco systems was up 2-7/16 at 98-5/16, dell computer rose 1/4 to 43-7/16. intel corp., a dow component, was up 1-3/16 at 80-1/8.copyright
